heading.emphasis:
Notes on the subspecies, and synonyms of
Hiperantha decorata ( Gory, 1841 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hiperantha decorata
is the most closely related species to
H. pikachu
sp. nov.
H. decorata
was originally described as
Paecilonota decorata
by Gory (1841) probably based on a single specimen (as only a single length is given) from Brazil . The original description is good and includes a clear illustration ( Fig. 23 ) that allows us to recognize the described species.
H. decorata
is a very variable species as evidenced by the existence of two non-nominate subspecies and five previously synonymized varieties or aberrations ( Bellamy, 2008 ). In order to dismiss the possibility that
H. pikachu
sp. nov.
corresponds to one of the previously described subspecies or varieties of
H. decorata
, we made a comparative analysis between the above-mentioned taxa (see Table 1 ). As a result, we conclude that the synonyms of
H. decorata
correspond to variations of the elytral pattern of the nominate form. Elytral patterns vary from immaculate (
var. insignata
), with only lateral spot (
var. univittata
), with lateral and preapical spot (nominate form), with spots fused, but not medially connected (
var. chabrillacei
), and spots fused to form a single U-shaped spot (
var. rambouseki
and
var. mrazi
).
H. pikachu
sp. nov.
exhibits a totally different elytral pattern, which does not fit in any of the known varieties of
H. decorata .

subSubSection.paragraph:
A specimen identified as
Hiperantha decorata sanguinolenta Cobos, 1963
by A. Cobos 1970 (DZUP 465195) is conspecific with
Hiperantha decorata ( Gory, 1841 )
(ab. insignata ). Confirmation of this possible synonymy awaits examination of the holotype of
H. decorata sanguinolenta .
We did not find type or identified specimens of
H. decorata maura Cobos, 1963
.

Distributional notes. Including
H. pikachu
sp. nov.
, the genus
Hiperantha
in Brazil currently includes 17 species and 4 subspecies (see Table 2 ). Besides the new taxon, only one species and two subspecies of
Hiperantha
have been so far recorded for the northeast region of Brazil ( Bahia state ).
